title: Bowl projections: Every matchup from the Celebration Bowl to the national title game
content: It's August and no games have been played, but we're breaking down who will be where in December and beyond.

title: Sources: NFLPA puts one of top lawyers on leave
content: The NFL Players Association put Heather McPhee, whose allegations helped prompt a federal investigation, on paid administrative leave after multiple employees filed complaints with the union's human resources department, sources said.

title: Browns' Judkins won't face charge for July arrest
content: Prosecutors have declined to file a formal misdemeanor battery charge against Browns rookie running back Quinshon Judkins, a spokesperson for the Broward State Attorney's Office in Florida told ESPN.

title: Bond won't be charged, says he's joining Browns
content: The sexual assault case against former Texas wide receiver Isaiah Bond has been no-billed and he faces no further criminal charges, Collin County (Texas) District Attorney Greg Willis said.

title: Hot-putting MacIntyre takes BMW lead with 62
content: Robert MacIntyre seized on a softer Caves Valley after a two-hour storm delay and rode the best putting round of his year with six straight birdies to post an 8-under 62 for a three-shot lead over Tommy Fleetwood in the BMW Championship.

title: Hello again: Durant, Davis returns mark NBA slate
content: The Rockets' Kevin Durant will make his return to Phoenix on Nov. 24, while the Mavericks' Anthony Davis will return to Los Angeles to play the Lakers on Nov. 28.

title: First-place Phillies to use 6 SPs with Nola return
content: Phillies manager Rob Thomson says he will use a six-man rotation beginning this weekend when Aaron Nola returns from the injured list.

title: Packers' Love: Surgery now so 100% for Week 1
content: Packers quarterback Jordan Love opted to have surgery on his left thumb this week because he didn't want to go into the season with any nagging injuries.

title: Rooney: Brady work ethic criticism was 'unfair'
content: Former Birmingham City manager Wayne Rooney has said Tom Brady's criticism about his work ethic was "unfair."

title: ðŸ“· Mets, Mariners players as Little Leaguers
content: From Cal Raleigh to Juan Soto, here's what players in this year's Little League Classic looked like as Little Leaguers themselves.

content: Which team has the best wide receivers? The shakiest edge rusher room? We ranked all 32 teams in 10 position groups.

content: Manning now has the reins of the Longhorns' offense, but what do evaluators think of him entering the season -- and when could he enter the NFL draft?

content: The European club season is upon us, which is a great time to start monitoring the U.S. player pool ahead of the men's World Cup. In a new weekly feature, we'll assess their progress on the road to next summer.

content: If you want national title contenders, look somewhere else. Here, Ryan McGee salutes the best of the worst.

content: From a Lynx-Liberty showdown to the regular-season finale, these are the most impactful WNBA games left.

content: After a crushing Super Bowl LIX loss, Mahomes has wowed teammates and coaches with his accuracy and focus this summer.

content: ESPN FC analyst and ex-Man City defender Nedum Onuoha, who won promotion with QPR, reveals how a team prepares for promotion to the Premier League.

title: What to know about the 2025 PFL lightweight, bantamweight and women's flyweight finals
content: The PFL World Championships finals continue Friday with Gadzhi Rabadanov vs. Alfie Davis and  Liz Carmouche vs. Jena Bishop.

title: After suffering a catastrophic injury, can UNC quarterback Max Johnson get his career back on track?
content: The son of Brad Johnson is entering his sixth year of college after rehabbing a broken leg, still hoping that he can play his way into the NFL draft.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Vlahovic as Lewandowski successor
content: Barcelona have been following Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic's situation closely. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: 2025 NFL betting preview: Three picks to make on your favorite team
content: Will your team beat its projected win total? What props should you target? Here are three bets we like for every NFL team.

title: NFL betting: Eight player props we like to hit the 'over' this season
content: Optimism is the theme, with the "over" bet being a popular play in Liz Loza and Daniel Dopp's "Props that Pop."

title: Centre Proposes Reducing GST Slabs From 4 To 2, May Retain 5%, 18%: Sources
content: The Centre has proposed that only two slabs for Goods and Services Tax (GST) be retained - 5 per cent and 18 percent - as per sources.

title: "Greed": Aaditya Thackeray Slams BCCI over India-Pak Asia Cup Matches
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) leader Aaditya Thackeray on Friday targeted the BCCI over India Pakistan cricket matches in the Asia Cup.

title: "Not Here To Negotiate For Ukraine": Trump Aboard Flight To Meet Putin
content: "HIGH STAKES!" That's what US President Donald Trump posted on his social media company Truth Social ahead of the flight to Alaska where he is scheduled to meet his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin, in an event being billed as historic.

title: 10 Pilgrims Dead, 35 injured As Bus Rams Truck Parked On Roadside In West Bengal
content: Ten pilgrims from Bihar died and 35 others were injured as their bus rammed into a truck parked on the roadside in West Bengal's Burdwan town on Friday, officials said.

title: AIMIM Leader Hosts 'Biryani Party' To Oppose Meat Ban In Maharashtra District
content: AIMIM leader Imtiaz Jaleel on Friday organised a "biryani party" at his residence here to mark his protest against the local civic body's order to keep the meat shops in the city shut on account of festivals.

title: 5 Killed After Roof Of Dargah Near Delhi's Humayun's Tomb Collapses
content: Five people were killed after part of the roof of a dargah, or the tomb of a Muslim saint, collapsed in Delhi's Nizamuddin area Friday evening.

title: From Putin To Netanyahu: Global leaders Wish India On Independence Day
content: Global leaders and neighbours extended greetings to India on the 79th Independence Day on Friday while reaffirming strong bilateral ties with the country.

title: How India's Choice Of August 15 As Independence Day Has A Japan Link
content: Amid rising communal violence and worsening law and order, the British Parliament decided that the colonial rule in India would end on August 15, 1947.

title: Chandrababu Naidu Launches Statewide Free Bus Travel Scheme For Women
content: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu on Friday launched 'Stree Shakti', a statewide free bus travel scheme for women, in the presence of NDA leaders here.

title: 60 Killed, 500 Feared Trapped After Cloudburst In J&K's Kishtwar
content: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference Chief Farooq Abdullah believes over 500 people continue to be trapped.

title: Jammu And Kashmir Cloudburst Highlights: Rescue Ops On As 46 Killed In Kishtwar, Chief Minister Cancels Independence Day Cultural Events
content: At least 46 people died, including two Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel,Â after a massive cloudburst struck Chashoti village in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Thursday.

title: Boy Killed, Many Injured In Cylinder Blast In Bengaluru, 6 Houses Damaged
content: A 10-year-old boy died while nine others were injured in a cylinder blast in central Bengaluru's Wilson Garden this morning.

title: Trump-Putin Alaska Meet: Hotels, Cabs Booked Out, Temporary Curbs On Flights
content: US President Donald Trump and his Russian counterpart, Vladimir Putin, are scheduled to meet on Friday in Alaska in a high-stakes and high-risk summit that could prove decisive for the future of Ukraine.

title: This Whale Species Was Smaller Than A Bed. Fossil Found On Australia Beach
content: A chance discovery of a 25 million-year-old fossil on an Australian beach has allowed paleontologists to identify a rare, entirely new species that could unlock mysteries of whale evolution.

title: Trump's Alaska Summit With Putin Most Important In His Second Presidency
content: The White House, and Trump himself, have played down expectations of an imminent breakthrough towards peace in Ukraine, claiming that this would be "a feel-out meeting" to determine whether a ceasefire is possible.

title: Khalistani Group Causes Ruckus As Indians Celebrate Independence Day In Australia
content: An event marking India's 79th Independence Day outside the Consul General in Australia's Melbourne was disrupted by pro-Khalistani individuals.

title: On Independent Day, A Message Of Unity In Srinagar From Rajasthan, Gujarat
content: In a display of patriotism and a message of national integration, two men--one from Rajasthan and the other from Gujarat--hoisted the national flag at the historic Ghanta Ghar in Srinagar's Lal Chowk on Friday.

title: Inside Putin-Trump Summit In Alaska: A Look At What Each Side Wants
content: The US and Russian presidents Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin are to meet at a US air base in Alaska on Friday for talks on the Ukraine war.

title: Man Found Dead In Kolkata Metro Tunnel, Probe On
content: The body of a man was found in the tunnel of Kolkata Metro's Blue Line in the early hours of Friday, officials said.

title: Trump, Putin To Meet In Alaska For High-Stakes Summit On Russia-Ukraine War
content: US President Donald Trump is meeting face-to-face with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska on Friday for a high-stakes summit that could determine not only the trajectory of the war in Ukraine but also the fate of European security.

title: Pakistan monsoon fury: Helicopter crashes during rescue mission; 5 dead
content: A Khyber Pakhtunkhwa government helicopter crashed in Pakistan's Mohmand district due to severe weather while carrying relief goods to rain-affected areas of Bajaur, resulting in the tragic death of all five crew members. The MI-17 helicopter lost contact en route from Peshawar, prompting a rescue operation.

title: Neerajâ€™s wife Himani rejects Rs 1.5 crore job offer; her father reveals why
content: Himani Mor, Neeraj Chopra's wife, transitions from professional tennis to sports business, declining a lucrative US job offer to pursue her own venture. Currently in Europe with Neeraj during his training, Himani holds a degree in Political Science and Sports Management. Neeraj, meanwhile, withdrew from the Silesia Diamond League, focusing on the World Athletics Championships in Tokyo.

title: Sam Altman on AI in India: If there is one large society in the world that seems ...
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman lauded India's enthusiastic adoption of AI, predicting it could become their largest market soon. He highlighted the nation's proactive integration of AI across various sectors, foreseeing significant societal and economic advancements. Altman emphasized India's shift towards becoming an AI producer, praising the entrepreneurial spirit driving innovation.

title: 'Retirement le lu?â€™: Rohit Sharma asks Rishabh Pant directly - WATCH
content: India clinched the ICC Champions Trophy 2025, defeating New Zealand in a thrilling final under Rohit Sharma's captaincy. Rishabh Pant's video captured the team's jubilant celebrations, including a playful exchange with Rohit about his retirement plans. Both Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are set to make their ODI comeback in the series against Australia in October.

title: Exclusive | Parents' sleepless nights, coding, and chess: India gets 89th GM in Rohith
content: Rohith Krishna S, a 19-year-old from Chennai, has become India's 89th Grandmaster, achieving his final GM norm at the Almaty Region Open. His journey, fueled by family support and sacrifices, involved countless hours of practice and international tournaments. Rohith now balances chess with his computer science studies, setting his sights on a 2600 rating and ultimately, the world championship.

title: Zoho co-founder Sridhar Vembu: Sparks AI warning and urges caution
content: Zoho's Sridhar Vembu advocates for responsible AI adoption in workplaces, balancing its potential with human oversight. He uses AI daily for learning, replacing web searches, and fostering critical thinking through AI debates. Vembu cautions against unethical AI practices in customer service and content creation, emphasizing AI's role in augmenting human intelligence, not replacing it.

title: GST rates to come down! 99% of items in 12% bracket may move to 5%
content: The Centre's proposed GST revamp is set to significantly alter tax slabs, with approximately 90% of items from the 28% bracket potentially moving to 18%. Furthermore, about 99% of goods currently in the 12% slab could be shifted to the 5% bracket.

title: Jamie Dimon on US-China tech race: Calls reliance on China â€˜embarrassingâ€™
content: The Nvidia H20 chip sales to China are under scrutiny. This has intensified the US-China tech rivalry. Jamie Dimon warns about US vulnerability. He points out dependence on China for essential goods. Chinese regulators question Nvidia chip purchases. They are pushing for domestic alternatives. Nvidia denies security risks. China is asking tech firms to reconsider Nvidia orders.

title: I-Day in Melbourne disrupted: Indians come face to face with Khalistan 'goons' - video
content: Independence Day celebrations at the Indian consulate in Melbourne faced disruption from Khalistani protesters, but attendees countered with patriotic songs. The consul general hoisted the flag amidst calls to strengthen India-Australia ties. This incident follows other Khalistani-linked activities in Australian cities, including temple vandalism and attacks on Indian students, raising concerns and prompting monitoring by local authorities.

title: Travis Kelce makes history: Taylor Swift stuns fans; New Heights podcast explodes
content: Pop star Taylor Swift made a surprise appearance on the 'New Heights' podcast with Travis and Jason Kelce. The episode became the most-watched in the podcast's history within 12 hours. Swift shared details about how her relationship with Travis Kelce began. Kelce had previously mentioned wanting to meet her on the podcast. They officially met on July 8, 2023.

title: Fighter jets to Rs 1L cr youth employment push - 10 key announcements by PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi addressed the nation on Independence Day, outlining initiatives for energy independence, domestic semiconductor production, and GST reforms. He introduced the PM Viksit Bharat Rojgar Yojana to boost job creation and emphasized prioritizing farmers' interests. Modi also warned against nuclear threats and criticized the Indus Waters Treaty, vowing to protect India's interests.

title: Independence Day: Rahul, Kharge absent from Red Fort event; BJP questions no-show
content: The BJP criticized Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge for not attending the Independence Day celebration at the Red Fort. Amit Malviya, BJP I-T cell chief, questioned Gandhi's absence and commitment to national events, also noting his disoriented appearance at the Congress HQ. He further emphasized that such absence sends a poor message about his commitment to national occasions.

title: Pakistan rains: 117 dead in 24 hours; over 320 killed since â€˜unusualâ€™ downpours began
content: Monsoon rains in Pakistan have caused widespread devastation, claiming at least 117 lives in the last 24 hours alone. Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province is the worst hit, with flash floods sweeping away homes and leaving many stranded. The meteorological department has issued warnings for further heavy rainfall.

title: Mahindra unveils 4 new concept SUVs, launch timeline revealed: Details
content: Mahindra & Mahindra unveiled its future SUV strategy, showcasing the NU_IQ platform and four concept vehicles as part of its Vision 2027 plan. Production models based on the NU_IQ platform, designed for versatile powertrain options and enhanced interior space, are expected to launch in 2027.

title: ICC slaps five-year ban on ex-cricketer for match fixing
content: Saliya Saman, a former Sri Lankan cricketer, has been banned from all cricket for five years after being found guilty of breaching the ECB Anti-Corruption Code. The charges relate to attempts to corrupt matches in the 2021 Abu Dhabi T10 Cricket League. Saman was found guilty on three counts, including attempting to fix matches and offering rewards for corrupt conduct.

title: Trump tariff impact: India faces hard choices, says GTRI; warns of $50 bn export hit
content: India faces a strategic dilemma as the US imposes a 50% tariff on most Indian goods, potentially costing India $50 billion. Options include negotiation, retaliation, export diversification, or offering concessions like halting Russian oil imports. Bilateral trade talks continue despite the dispute, with aims to significantly increase trade by 2030.

title: MS Dhoni's seven-word message: 'Consider me as retired'
content: Five years ago, MS Dhoni, India's celebrated captain and wicketkeeper, retired from international cricket, marking the end of an era. His leadership led India to victories in the T20 World Cup (2007), the ODI World Cup (2011), and the Champions Trophy (2013), making him the only captain to win all three major ICC white-ball trophies.

title: Dwyane Wade & Gabrielle Union: Cozy time with pup Trey
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union shared heartwarming moments with their French bulldog, Trey, on social media, showcasing their love for their pet. Despite Union's humorous aversion to Trey in the bedroom, as revealed in a playful debate, the couple's affection for their dog is evident. Wade's bond with Trey is strong, as highlighted by beach outings and emotional bonding.

title: â€˜Senior terrorist eliminatedâ€™: IDF says Hamas military control dept head killed
content: The IDF announced the killing of Nasser Moussa, a senior Hamas figure, in an airstrike in southern Gaza. Moussa, responsible for training and operations, was a close associate of a previously eliminated commander. The IDF also targeted rocket storage sites. Amid ongoing military actions, a deepening humanitarian crisis unfolds in Gaza, with rising casualties and accusations of restricted aid.

title: 'Glorifying RSS an insult to freedom struggle': Owaisi criticises PM Modi's speech
content: Asaduddin Owaisi has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for praising the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) during his Independence Day speech. Owaisi described Modi's glorification of the RSS as an insult to the freedom struggle, accusing the organization of not participating in the independence movement and opposing Mahatma Gandhi.

title: â€˜Rs 15,000 in 1st pvt job': PM Modi unveils Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana; what the scheme offers
content: Prime Minister Modi introduced the PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana on Independence Day, effective from August 1, 2025. This initiative aims to generate 3.5 crore jobs in two years, with a focus on first-time job seekers. The scheme provides incentives for both employees and employers to boost hiring and economic growth, with a substantial budget allocated for its implementation.

title: 'Your country enjoys well-deserved respect': Putin wishes PM Modi on I-Day
content: On India's Independence Day, Russia extended warm greetings to President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, acknowledging India's significant achievements across various sectors. Vladimir Putin emphasized the strategic partnership between the two nations and expressed eagerness to broaden bilateral cooperation. This message arrives amidst US tariff threats and geopolitical tensions, highlighting the enduring bond between Russia and India.

title: â€˜Biggest NGO in the worldâ€™: PM Modi hails RSS in I-Day speech
content: On the 79th Independence Day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) from the Red Fort, acknowledging its century of service to the nation. He hailed the RSS as the world's largest NGO, emphasizing its dedication to nation-building and welfare.

title: Watch: 2 BJP MLAs clash inside UP assembly; Akhilesh shares viral video
content: A video capturing a heated argument between BJP lawmakers Rajesh Chaudhary and Saurabh Srivastava during the Uttar Pradesh assembly's monsoon session has gone viral. The clash erupted when Chaudhary, representing Mathura, was denied his allocated speaking time due to extended speeches by others. Srivastava, acting as chief whip, engaged in a verbal exchange with Chaudhary, prompting intervention from other members.

title: 'Greed for money stands above sacrifice': Aaditya Thackeray on India vs Pakistan
content: Aaditya Thackeray has strongly criticised the BCCI for prioritising financial interests over national sentiment by agreeing to play against Pakistan in the Asia Cup. This follows the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. Thackeray questioned the BCCI's decision, highlighting Prime Minister Modi's warning against any enemy misadventures.

title: PM Modi announces task force to consider next-gen reforms - What will it do?
content: PM Modi unveiled plans for major economic reforms. A task force will be formed to modernise laws. The goal is to boost self-reliance and economic growth. The task force will revise existing laws. It will reduce burdens on businesses. Next-generation GST reforms are coming. These reforms will lower taxes on everyday items. The changes aim to benefit citizens directly.

title: Nagpur guitar teacher rapes 17-year-old at gunpoint; held
content: In Nagpur, a 17-year-old student was allegedly repeatedly raped and blackmailed at gunpoint by her guitar teacher, Sagar Singh Parosiya, over two months. He threatened her and her family, forcing her to his apartment. Police arrested Parosiya and recovered a sword from his residence, adding charges under the Arms Act and POCSO Act.

title: Flash floods in Pak: Widespread destruction reported; at least 49 killed in north-west
content: Heavy rains have triggered devastating flash floods in north-western Pakistan and other regions, resulting in at least 49 deaths in the last 24 hours. Since late June, over 360 people, predominantly women and children, have perished in rain-related incidents nationwide. Pak-occupied Gilgit-Baltistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa provinces have been particularly hard-hit, with numerous casualties and significant infrastructure damage reported.

title: Kishtwar cloudburst: 60 dead, over 100 injured; PM Modi assures all help to J&K CM
content: Following the devastating cloudburst in Kishtwar's Chasoti village, which resulted in 60 fatalities and over 100 injuries, Prime Minister Modi has assured Jammu and Kashmir of full support. The disaster, occurring during the Machail Mata Yatra, caused widespread destruction. Rescue operations are ongoing, with helpline numbers established to aid those affected by the floods.

title: 10 dead, 35 injured as Bihar-bound bus rams into truck in West Bengal's Burdwan
content: A tragic accident in West Bengal's Burdwan district claimed the lives of at least 10 people and left 35 injured. A passenger bus collided with a stationary truck on National Highway 19 near Nala Ferry Ghat around 7 am on Friday. Rescue teams promptly responded, transporting the injured to nearby hospitals.

title: 'War 2' box office collection (Live): Hrithik, Jr NTR and Kiara starrer chases Rs 100 cr
content: YRF's 'War 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, debuted strongly but faces stiff competition. The action sequel earned an estimated Rs 52.50 crore on day one, boosted by the Telugu version. However, Hindi openings lagged behind other Spy Universe films. Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' poses a significant challenge, earning impressive figures.

title: Big GST cheer for common man! 2-slab tax structure to replace 5-28% rates; key details shared by govt
content: Prime Minister Modi announced upcoming GST reforms aimed at easing the burden on citizens, farmers, and MSMEs. The proposed changes include a simplified two-slab structure and rate rationalization. These reforms focus on structural improvements, rate adjustments, and enhancing the ease of living, with implementation expected this financial year.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo to play in India? Al Nassr drawn with FC Goa in AFC Champions League Two
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's Al Nassr has been drawn alongside FC Goa in the AFC Champions League Two group stage, raising hopes of the Portuguese star playing in India. However, his appearance is uncertain due to contract conditions regarding away travel. Mohun Bagan Super Giant too, will participate in the competition, adding to the excitement for Indian football fans.

title: MP principal booked for molesting; hugged class 7 girl to â€˜relieve depressionâ€™
content: In Vidisha district, a government school principal faces charges under the POCSO Act for allegedly attempting to hug a class 7 student, claiming it would alleviate his "depression." The incident, which occurred on July 26, surfaced after the girl reported it on August 11, alleging threats from the principal to remain silent about the ordeal.

title: FASTag annual pass launch: Steps to activate Rs 3,000 pass easily; key benefits, FAQs
content: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) will launch the FASTag Annual Pass on August 15, 2025, priced at Rs 3,000 for private vehicles. This pass allows up to 200 trips on designated National Highways and Expressways or is valid for one year. Activation is through the Rajmarg Yatra app or NHAI website, simplifying toll payments for frequent travelers.

title: Watch: Manu Bhaker marks Independence Day with violin tribute
content: Olympic medalist Manu Bhaker celebrated India's 79th Independence Day by sharing a video of herself playing the national anthem on the violin. The accomplished shooter expressed her deep desire to stand on the podium, listening to the anthem, every time she represents India. Bhaker's impressive career includes Olympic medals, World Championship wins, and success at the Commonwealth and Asian Games.

title: 'Infiltrators snatching bread & butter': PM announces demographic mission on I-Day
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing the nation on Independence Day, warned of a premeditated conspiracy to alter India's demography through illegal infiltration. He asserted that these "ghuspaithiyas" pose a threat by snatching opportunities from the youth, targeting women, and encroaching on tribal lands. Modi announced a high-powered demographic mission to tackle this crisis within a set timeframe.

title: CBSE warns against fake agents: Bogus document services flagged; students told to stay vigilant
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has warned students, parents, and stakeholders against fraudulent agents falsely claiming to offer quick services for duplicate mark sheets, certificates, and record corrections. CBSE clarified such operators are unauthorised and urged reliance only on its official website, stressing it will not be liable for losses from third-party dealings.

title: 'Kehna kya chahte ho?': Shashi Tharoorâ€™s punny reply leaves internet in splits
content: Shashi Tharoor, known for his impressive vocabulary, responded humorously to a social media user's deliberately complex comment regarding US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's description of India as "recalcitrant" in trade negotiations. Tharoor defended India's approach, stating it's better to be recalcitrant than submissive to injustice, amidst rising trade tensions and new tariffs imposed by the US.

title: Independence Day: 'Country's demography is being changed'- Top quotes from PM's speech
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the nation from the Red Fort on the 79th Independence Day, marking his 12th consecutive address. He paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi and hoisted the flag, emphasising the theme of 'Naya Bharat' and the vision of 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047. Modi saluted the armed forces and highlighted India's stance against nuclear threats, referencing actions taken after the Pahalgam attack.

title: Andhra Pradesh committed to poverty eradication and 24x7 quality power: Minister
content: Gottipati Ravi Kumar outlines key welfare initiatives, infrastructure upgrades, and clean energy goals at 79th Independence Day celebrations in Bapatla

title: Upgraded 112 emergency support system formally launched
content: The next-generation Emergency Response Support System (ERSS) aims at enhancing service accessibility and ensure faster response times through the integration of advanced technologies.

title: Marksheet scam in Gulbarga University: loss pegged at â‚¹11.67 crore
content: As per the rules of NEP, instead of physical marksheets, it is mandatory to issue digital marksheets to students who have completed their degrees. But the varsity has violated the govt. order and printed marksheets

title: 175 MSME Parks will be developed in A.P. as part of â€˜Vision 2047â€™, says Minister
content: Kondapalli Srinivas urges the people to understand governmentâ€™s concept â€œOne family-One entrepreneurâ€ and take advantage of the schemes launched for quick industrial growth of the State

title: Various events mark 79th Independence Day in Alappuzha
content: Fisheries Minister hoists national flag at Alappuzha Recreation ground. He urges people to remain vigilant against divisive forces

title: Structure collapse near Humayunâ€™s Tomb: Many people feared trapped; rescue underway | LIVE
content: Several teams are at the spot to rescue people trapped under the rubble. According to police sources 11 people have been rescued already

title: Lokesh invokes Gandhian ideals, promises welfare and growth in Andhra Pradesh
content: At Gunturâ€™s 79th Independence Day celebrations, he hails local freedom struggle heroes, announces a Mangalagiri museum, and outlines reforms in welfare, education, and development

title: Smart metering: KSEB to form dedicated sub-division for monitoring implementation
content: Around three lakh meters will be installed in the first phase. Close to 1.5 lakh single phase meters will be installed at government offices alone.

title: Almost 1,500 convicts at Tihar Jail given special remission on 79th Independence Day
content: The Tihar Jail currently has more than 18,000 inmates. The prison complex spreads across Jail Number 1 to 16, with Jail Number 6 and 16 specially designed to house women prisoners

title: ICAI holds council meeting in Pahalgam, first such high-level gathering since April 22 attack
content: The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India celebrates Independence Day in Pahalgam, symbolising hope, unity, and commitment to rebuilding trust in Kashmir Valley

title: Police given 'absolute power' to act in cases of crimes against women: Odisha CM Mohan Charan Majhi
content: Addressing the Independence Day function, Mohan Charan Majhi said his government will not hesitate to bring a special legislation to "completely end" organised crimes

title: With Durga Puja 45 days away, Kumartuli going through busiest time in year
content: The iconic north Kolkata neighbourhood is filled with idol makers trying to meet the Puja deadline, and visitors shooting their craftsmanship

title: Shwetha Menon, Kukku Parameswaran create history as first women to lead Malayalam actorsâ€™ body AMMA
content: In a keenly contested election, Shwetha Menon and Kukku Parameswaran have been elected president and general secretary, defeating Devan and Raveendran, respectively

title: Four persons suffocated to death in septic tank in Jharkhandâ€™s Garhwa
content: Sub Divisional Officer of Garhwa, Sanjay Kumar, said that it was a newly built septic tank, and the incident happened when one after the other, all four persons entered it to clean planks after removing shutterings

title: When water scorches the earth
content: Over one lakh coconut trees have died over the past six years in the Central Godavari Delta as saline backwaters from a once-life giving watercourse poisons soil in nine villages. The man-made disaster has crippled lives and paralysed local economies and threatens to tear asunder an age-old bond between people and a vital crop, writes T. Appala Naidu

title: Bribe and prejudice: when graft charges slip through the cracks in Telangana
content: In Telangana, instances of officers getting caught taking a bribe may spark a scandal, but it is rarely a career-ender. Bureaucratic delays, alleged shoddy investigations and â€˜political shieldingâ€™ drag cases to a crawl. Many accused officers not only return to their posts but climb the ranks, while prosecutions fade into obscurity. The result? A system that claims to fight graft but too often shields the corrupt.Â Lavpreet KaurÂ exposes how anti-corruption cases end without a sense of justice
